thread.title: Nigeria: One Dead, Crew Members Trapped in Ship Collision Off Nigerian Waters
thread.title_full: Nigeria: One Dead, Crew Members Trapped in Ship Collision Off Nigerian Waters

title: Nigeria: One Dead, Crew Members Trapped in Ship Collision Off Nigerian Waters
text:
Cote d'Ivoire: Peace-CI Opens Cote d'Ivoire's Largest Election Situation Room By Eugene Agha Lagos — One person has been confirmed dead and three rescued, with eight others presently trapped in an accident involving two merchant ships off Nigerian coaster waters. The two ships, MT Elixir and MT Tank collided midstream some 10 nautical miles south west of the multi-billion dollar Bonga FPSO, near Warri in Delta State. The crew were reportedly rescued by naval personnel attached to the Nigerian Maritime Administration and Safety Agency (NIMASA) who were sent on a search and rescue mission minutes after the two ships collided. The Agency's Deputy Head of Public Relations, Hajia Lamin Tumaka who confirmed the incident, said divers and other rescue personnel were still at the site where about eight crew members of MT. Tank appeared to have been trapped.‎ She said preliminary reports showed that the incident occurred at about 12 midnight on Monday and that MT Tank got broken in the process and took in waters. "Search and Rescue personnel of the Agency have rescued three crew members and recovered one body from the incident which occurred about 65 miles from shore, just 10 nautical miles south west of the Bonga FPSO near Warri where two vessels; MT Elixir and MT Tank collided midstream. "Divers and other rescue personnel are still at the site of the incident where eight crew members of MT. Tank appeared to have been trapped," she stated. Nigeria
